articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Phil Stewart, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Iran and Israel traded air and missile strikes as the world braced on Monday for Tehran's response to the U.S. attack on its nuclear sites and U.S. President Donald Trump raised the idea of regime change in the Islamic republic.
articles.title: Iran weighs retaliation against U.S. for strikes on nuclear sites

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: An overnight Russian drone and missile attack in and around Kyiv killed one person, sparked fires in residential areas and damaged an entrance to a metro station that serves as a bomb shelter, Ukrainian authorities said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia's attack on Kyiv region kills one, sparks fires, Ukraine says

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Iran's supreme leader sent his foreign minister to Moscow on Monday to ask President Vladimir Putin for more help from Russia after the biggest U.S. military action against the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution over the weekend.
articles.title: Iran's supreme leader asks Putin to do more after US strikes

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: The NATO alliance has crafted a summit in The Hague this week to shore itself up by satisfying President Donald Trump with a big new defence spending goal - but it now risks being dominated by the repercussions of his military strikes on Iran.
articles.title: Hague NATO summit aims to focus on Trump's spending goal but Iran looms large

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: The clock's ticking for senior clerics seeking a successor to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.
articles.title: Succession plans for Iran's Khamenei hit top gear

articles.author: Leila  Miller
articles.description: On a Buenos Aires residential street, two protesters painted a telling image in colorful strokes: a portrait of a lone woman on her balcony overlooking a mass of people below.
articles.title: Argentina's ex-President Kirchner, under house arrest, plots political fight-back - from her balcony

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's government said on Monday it would push ahead with a cabinet reshuffle this week, facing down a backlash against its handling of a border row with Cambodia that has left Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra hanging on to power by a thread.
articles.title: Thailand heads into political turbulence as Cambodia row festers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Greece will send more than 170 more firefighters on Monday to reinforce teams battling wildfires on the Greek island of Chios for a second day, as winds further whipped up the blaze, bringing power cuts and spurring the evacuation of residents.
articles.title: Greece to reinforce firefighting teams on Chios as wildfires rage for second day

articles.author: Trixie Yap, Siyi Liu
articles.description: At least two supertankers made U-turns at the Strait of Hormuz following U.S. military strikes on Iran, shiptracking data shows, as more than a week of violence in the region prompts vessels to speed, pause, or alter their journeys.
articles.title: Tankers U-turn, zig-zag, pause around Strait of Hormuz

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hungary and Slovakia have decided not to support the EU's plan for an 18th sanctions package against Russia, Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto said on Monday in a press briefing broadcast on his Facebook page.
articles.title: Hungary and Slovakia block Russian sanctions package, Budapest says
